reference.title: Viewing the properties of a dictionary

section.p: The main properties of a dictionary are: Name The name of the dictionary. It cannot be changed for an existing dictionary. Source language The source of the dictionary, this means, the language of the terms (headwords). It cannot be changed for an existing dictionary. Drive The drive where the dictionary resides. It cannot be changed for an existing dictionary. Description The description of the dictionary. It can be up to 255 characters long. Location Can be local (only one translator at a time can use it) or shared (several translators can use it simultaneously). Entry fields Contains the entry fields that make up the dictionary structure. For an existing dictionary you can only change the name of a field and the lookup panel number. Protected? Specifies whether the dictionary is protected against unauthorized modifications.
